DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Serum Glutamic Oxaloacetic Transferase Upper Limit of Normal Result Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related to the top value of the range of statistical characteristics result of a medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood for serum glutamic-oxalacetic transaminase, pyridoxal phosphate-dependent enzymes involved in amino acid metabolism and in the urea and tricarboxylic acid cycles.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Serum Glutamic Oxaloacetic Transferase Upper Limit of Normal Result
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the top value of the range of statistical characteristics result of a medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood for serum glutamic-oxalacetic transaminase, pyridoxal phosphate-dependent enzymes involved in amino acid metabolism and in the urea and tricarboxylic acid cycles.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredName: SGOT (AST) Upper Limit of Normal Outcome
Property.preferredDefinition: Activity measured as a test of liver function, 46/47-kDa homodimeric human Aspartate Aminotransferases (Class-I Pyridoxal-Phosphate-Dependent Aminotransferase Family) are pyridoxal phosphate-dependent enzymes involved in amino acid metabolism and in the urea and tricarboxylic acid cycles. (NCI):The top value of the range of statistical characteristics that are supposed to represent accepted standard, non-pathological pattern for particular laboratory result or other quantitative parameter.:Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

Concepts.definition: A family of pyridoxal phosphate-dependent enzymes involved in amino acid metabolism and in the urea and tricarboxylic acid cycles. Aspartate aminotransferase specifically and reversibly catalyzes the transfer of an amino group from L-aspartate to alpha-ketoglutarate forming oxaloacetate and L-glutamate.
The top value of the range of statistical characteristics that are supposed to represent accepted standard, non-pathological pattern for particular laboratory result or other quantitative parameter.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
